meanings.definition: One of two or more alternative forms of a gene that can occupy a specific locus on a chromosome.
meanings.sent1: In genetics, an allelomorph determines specific traits in organisms.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study allelomorphs to understand inheritance patterns.
meanings.sent3: The allelomorphs at play in the DNA seemed to be having a little dance party.
meanings.sent4: The allelomorph acted like a key, unlocking the genetic code.
meanings.sent5: The concept of allelomorphs can be as complex as a secret code waiting to be deciphered.

meanings.definition: A variant form of a morpheme.
meanings.sent1: In linguistics, an allelomorph can change the meaning of a word.
meanings.sent2: The allelomorph in this word alters its grammatical function.
meanings.sent3: The allelomorphs in the language seemed to be playing a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The allelomorph was like a chameleon, adapting to different contexts.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful examples to explain the role of allelomorphs in words.
